title: New Pixel 4a5g charges slowly or not at all
content:
Hello,

I believe this charging issue is different from the Android 11 update battery issue which is a known issue.

About a week ago (so 2+ months from the Android 11 release), my Pixel 4a5g began showing a number of charging issues:
1) It sometimes becomes very hot while charging
2) It charges very slowly (e.g. 6+ hours to reach ~50%)
3) It refuses to charge past 50% to 60%
4) Sometimes, it will not charge at all (e.g., leave it plugged in all night, and it is at the same battery percentage (e.g. 16%) as it was when I went to bed
5) It consumes battery rapidly (i.e., the phone has gone from lasting for two days without a charge to about 3-4 hours from 50%)

I have checked the battery settings and it does not look like any one app is causing this issue.

However, I have found that the phone regains its previous charging speed if I charge it while powered off, or charge it immediately after a power off/restart sequence.

Does anyone have any suggestions for diagnostics I could perform to try to figure out what is going on? Thank you!
